channel.title: Custom Resource Definitions on
channel.description: Recent content in Custom Resource Definitions on

item.title: View CRD List
item.description:
This section explains how to view the list of custom resource definitions.

Prerequisites

You should join a cluster and have the Custom Resource Definition Viewing permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Custom Resource Definition Viewing permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click CRDs in the left navigation pane.

    • The custom resource definition list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Category

item.title: View CRD Details
item.description:
This section explains how to view details of a custom resource definition.

Prerequisites

You should join a cluster and have the Custom Resource Definition Viewing permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Custom Resource Definition Viewing permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click CRDs in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click the name of a custom resource definition in the list to open its details page.

  4. View the resource attributes of the custom resource definition in the Attributes section on the left side of the CRD details page.

    Parameter Description

    Cluster

item.title: Edit Custom Resource
item.description:
This section explains how to edit a custom resource.

Prerequisites

You should join a cluster and have the Custom Resource Definition Management permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Custom Resource Definition Management permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click CRDs in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click the name of a custom resource definition in the list to open its details page.

  4. On the CRDs tab, click on on the right side of the custom resource you want to edit, and then select Edit YAML from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Edit YAML dialog, modify the YAML settings of the custom resource, and then click OK.

    • Click on in the upper right corner of the dialog to upload a local YAML configuration file.

    • Click on in the upper right corner of the dialog to download the YAML configuration file to your local machine.

item.title: Delete Custom Resources
item.description:
This section explains how to delete a custom resource.

Warning

Deleting custom resources may cause interruptions to related services. Please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

You should join a cluster and have the Custom Resource Definition Management permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Custom Resource Definition Management permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click CRDs in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click the name of a custom resource definition in the list to open its details page.

  4. On the CRDs tab, click on the right of the custom resource you want to delete, then choose Delete from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Delete CRD dialog, enter the name of the custom resource, then click OK.
